      • getIssueId

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getIssueId(IssueServiceConfiguration issueServiceConfiguration,
                                                       java.lang.String token)
        Description copied from interface: IssueServiceExtension
        Normalises a string into a valid issue key if possible, in order for it to be useable in a search. This allows for services to adjust the token for cases where the representation of an issue might be different from its actual indexed value. For example, in GitHub, the representation might #12 while the value to search on is 12.
        Parameters:
        issueServiceConfiguration - Configuration for the service
        token - Token to transform into a key
        Returns:
        Valid token or Optional.empty().

      • getLinkedIssues

        public java.util.Collection<? extends Issue> getLinkedIssues(Project project,
                                                             IssueServiceConfiguration issueServiceConfiguration,
                                                             Issue issue)
        Description copied from interface: IssueServiceExtension
        Gets the list of linked issues that can be used to look for issues references (commits, revisions...) accross severak branches.

        By default, returns a collection that contains only issue.

        Parameters:
        project - Project to use for any additional configuration
        issueServiceConfiguration - Configuration for the service
        issue - Root or seeding issue
        Returns:
        List of issues linked to issue. It must include the initial issue.

      • validIssueToken

        public boolean validIssueToken(java.lang.String token)
        Description copied from interface: IssueServiceExtension
        Checks if a token may represent a valid issue token.
        Parameters:
        token - Token to test
        Returns:
        true if the token may represent an issue

      • extractIssueKeysFromMessage

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> extractIssueKeysFromMessage(IssueServiceConfiguration issueServiceConfiguration,
                                                                   java.lang.String message)
        Description copied from interface: IssueServiceExtension
        Given a message, extracts the issue keys from the message
        Parameters:
        issueServiceConfiguration - Configuration for the service
        message - Message to scan
        Returns:
        List of keys (can be empty, never null)

      • getMessageAnnotator

        public java.util.Optional<MessageAnnotator> getMessageAnnotator(IssueServiceConfiguration issueServiceConfiguration)
        Description copied from interface: IssueServiceExtension
        Returns a message annotator that can be used to extract information from a commit message. According to the service type and its configuration, they could be or not a possible annotator.

      • getLinkForAllIssues

        public java.lang.String getLinkForAllIssues(IssueServiceConfiguration issueServiceConfiguration,
                                            java.util.List<Issue> issues)
        Description copied from interface: IssueServiceExtension
        Given a list of issues, returns a link that allows the user to display the list of all those issues in a browser.
        Parameters:
        issueServiceConfiguration - Configuration for the service
        issues - List of issues to display. Can be empty, but not null.
        Returns:
        Link

      • getIssue

        public Issue getIssue(IssueServiceConfiguration issueServiceConfiguration,
                      java.lang.String issueKey)
        Description copied from interface: IssueServiceExtension
        Given a key, tries to find the issue with this key.
        Parameters:
        issueServiceConfiguration - Configuration for the service
        issueKey - Issue key
        Returns:
        Issue if found, null otherwise

      • followLinks

        public void followLinks(JIRAConfiguration configuration,
                        JIRAIssue seed,
                        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> linkNames,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,JIRAIssue> collectedIssues)
        Given an issue seed, and a list of link names, follows the given links recursively and puts the associated issues into the collectedIssues map.
        Parameters:
        configuration - JIRA configuration to use to load the issues
        seed - Issue to start from.
        linkNames - Links to follow
        collectedIssues - Collected issues, indexed by their key
